=== Current Testing Phase ===

* Current Release: Ubuntu Edgy Eft Stable Release
* Testing Date: December 28, 2006

=== Current Issues ===

'''Installation procedure:''' Screen goes blank even if computer is started in safe graphics mode (xforcevesa kernel switch). xorg.conf has to be edited (either to vesa or with the correct options to the device section) and xserver restarted. If vesa driver is selected then after installation is completed xorg.conf has to be edited with the correct options or fglrx has to be installed, otherwise graphics are extremly slow. My relevant xorg.conf portion (for dual head) is posted in the notes section.

=== Notes ===

==== xorg.conf configuration ====

Section "ServerLayout"
  ...

  Identifier  "Default Layout"

  Screen      "Default Screen"

  Option      "AIGLX" "on"  #Required for 3D accelaration

  ...
EndSection

Section "Device"
  Identifier "ATI Radeon X700"

  Driver     "ati"

  BusID      "PCI :1:0:0"  #remove the space between PCI and :

  Option     "BIOSHotKeys"                 "on"  #This enables Fn+{f7,f8} combinations

  Option     "MonitorLayout"               "LVDS, NONE" #Change to "LVDS, CRT" if using dual head

  Option     "XAANoOffscreenPixmaps"       #This is useful for AIGLX accelaration

  Option     "CRT2Position"                "LeftOf" #This controls the position of the second screen

  Option     "EnablePageFlip"              "on" #This will increase performance but not work correctly in some rare cases

  Option     "MergedXinerama"              "on" #In this mode you have a single shared framebuffer with two viewports looking into it

  Option     "MergedNonRectangular"        "on" #Keeps the smaller head from scrolling within the larger virtual desktop                                                

  Option     "MergedXineramaCRT2IsScreen0" "no" #Choose you primary screen

  Option     "MetaModes"                   "1440x900-1280x1024 1024x768-1024x768 1024x768" #The resolution combination of the two screens. Note that each individual resolution has to be present in the Modes section of the Screen section.

EndSection

Section "Monitor"
  Identifier "Laptop Monitor"

  Option     "DPMS"
EndSection

Section "Screen"
  Identifier   "Default Screen"

  Device       "ATI Radeon X700"

  Monitor      "Laptop Monitor"

  DefaultDepth 24

  SubSection "Display"
    Depth 24

    Modes "1440x900" "1280x1024" "1024x768"
  EndSubSection
EndSection

Section "DRI"
  Mode 0666
EndSection

Section "Extensions"
  Option "Composite" "Enable"
EndSection
